Posts.Content: {{{Katie}}}, I hope you can feel these hugs we're sending you.  Having a special someone close to you during treatment is absolutely the best medicine.  My DH went to all my treatments and tests with me and my family and friends were there but my "Katie" was my sister, El... someone you can share that look with, things you could do that would make you laugh so hard you can't catch your breath, maybe even have a Depends moment.  I know you had many moments like that with Shells.
Posts.Title: Thanking the Katies of the world.

Posts.Content: Hey Deb, what wonderful news.  We'll do the happy dancing... you watch and rest.  Take care of Debbie and lean on the love around you.

Posts.Content: Wow Miss Luci.  Sorry to hear of your "new wrinkle".  As usual you seem to have everything planned out and under control.  I'd like to be half as organized as you are.  When you hold a class on that please sign me up.  Till then I'll be sending out prayers for less pain and I'll be packing my fleece for the trip on the PCE December 2.
Posts.Title: Tramflap gone awry....
Happy Birthday Becky!

Posts.Content: Happy Birthday Miss Luci.  Enjoy your day doing everything that makes you smile.  I'll see you later for the ice cream.
Posts.Title: Happy Birthday Luci !!

Posts.Content: Hi Deb.  There should be a warning label for Senior Citizens on anything with new technology.  One of my dear sons bought us a dvd recorder/player last Christmas (we're still trying to figure it out so I guess it can count as a this year also).  When we "try" and play a dvd we have the two remotes... we keep pushing buttons and watching a blue screen for a while... push more buttons... by some miracle when the picture does come on we don't know how or what we did.  We recorded a movie once but did something wrong as it shows up as six separate movies instead of one... I think DH hit the pause button. We also seem to be having a problem turning off the dvd recorder/player after the dvd is removed, so now I just pull out the plug.
Posts.Title: Funniest/Worst/Strangest Christmas Gift

Posts.Content: Wow Bev, I'll join that happy dancing chorus line.  Great news with the pork chop bone diagnosis.  We'll take that anytime.  I've been going through my "allergic to the change of season time" so missed your 11th anniversary, but now I'm feeling almost human and wanted to send belated congratulations.  We love good news, keep it coming.
Posts.Title: pork chop bone remains the diagnosis...
Happy belated Birthday LoriG...Tavish !!!

Posts.Content: Sending many birthday wishes your way.  Hope you are doing something to make you smile today.  I don't have cake but I'll have some ice cream just for you.  Love and Hugs, Libby
Posts.Title: Happy, Happy Birthday Cathi.............

Posts.Content: Sending prayers out for Jo-Ann and her "Cruella".  It's hard to see our little ones get hurt.  I like Bev's observation that the ornery ones have the hardest heads.  Waiting to hear from Jo-Ann that all is well.
Posts.Title: Jo-Ann is asking for your prayers for her Cruella..

Posts.Content:
Hi Bev.  I'll be there for your MRI tomorrow, hoping for a pork chop bone.  We've just been trying to "get our house in shape".  Lived here for 35 years now.  Our son comes up from NC to do our painting.  I'll head him out your way... LOL.  He cleans, preps and then paints and works on the trim.  He just did a couple of our closets couple weeks ago when he was up.  (You have to paint closets?)  And to think we used to just 
open up a can of paint and slap it on the wall.  Who knew.  Good luck with all your work...it does get exhausting.

 20 years ago so I don't remember a lot about
 it.  I did have it done in gyn office and do remember it wasn't bad.  After that the pap tests came back normal.

Posts.Title: Hair is falling out...........

Posts.Content: (((MK)))  Wow, I would have been pulling my hair out.  What a day you had.  I hate when you try and fix one problem and just get deeper into more problems.   And I just love the computerized listings that most all companies have nowadays... usually takes me 5 minutes to go through them and none of the options is TALK TO A "REAL" PERSON.  I did end up getting one at our health insurance company but now I forget how I did that.  Oh well.  Can I send gentle hugs to your computer?  Gentle hugs, Libby

Posts.Content: Hi Laure, I'm the one that lives in Northern New Jersey (but not as far northwest as you will be).  I don't know anything about Lafayette but I do know Whippany.  Please click on my e-mail and I hope I can help in some small way.  You've come to a great place, the ladies here are caring, knowledgeable, loving and we give the best hugs.  Right now I'll begin that B9 chant... it's our favorite word... benign.  Welcoming Hugs, Libby

Posts.Content: Hi Emmeria.  Adding my welcome and hello from New Jersey.  Hugs, Libby
Posts.Title: Welcome, Emmeria!

Posts.Content: Joyce, even PCE pilots can get to feeling under the weather.  I'm climbing aboard for Cathi's onc visit and hopefully chemo.  Please just make sure the heat is on Capt. Lemon cause it's freezing here.  Packing prayers and hugs for Cathi.  Hugs, Libby
Posts.Title: PCE loading up for Cathi!

Posts.Content: Hey Cathi, Happy Valentine's wishes for your 5th anniversary.  I had once told you that you were one of the strongest women I knew, and you are.  You are awesome lady and I am proud to call you friend.
Posts.Title: 5 years ago today I was told I had Breast Cancer..........

Posts.Content: Oh Cathi sounds like you had an all around exhausting day.  I'm so glad your "angel" Marilyn is able to be with you.  Scarey stuff that diabetes, hope it is soon under control.  Gentle hugs, Libby
Posts.Title: What a day......

Posts.Content: Gail, this doc sounds like a gem.  Like that he's so thorough.  Hope this med works wonders for you...it's not easy living in constant pain.  Gentle hugs hon, Libby
Posts.Title: Well I am home from Spokane

Posts.Content: Here I come, hope I'm not late boarding.  This PCE sure has been busy lately.  Captain we don't have to worry about gas money, we can fly on a "Wing and a Prayer".  Hugs, Libby
Posts.Title: PCE loading up yet again!

Posts.Content: Nancyjo, glad everything went well Tuesday.  It was a good trip out west and we were able to get away from this winter weather.  Now rest and like Lori said, let others pamper you.  Hugs, Libby
Posts.Title: Done with surgery

Posts.Content: Okay, I'm climbing aboard with my pink boa (it's a little hair thing that I wear on my wrist) for our trip to VA.  Wow allergy free PCE ... great.  I love cats but am highly allergic to them.  Now we can all travel together.  I'm packing prayers Laure for good news.  Hugs, Libby
Posts.Title: PCE loading for our new member

Posts.Content: How sad Di.  Sending my sympathies, prayers and hugs to the family and to you.  Hugs, Libby
Posts.Title: Prayers please

Posts.Content: Sending gentle hugs and prayers for sweet Becky.  Thanks for all you do Angela, you are a treasure.  Hugs, Libby
Posts.Title: Continued Prayers for Becky...

Posts.Content: Happy Birthday to you dear Sara.  When my sister sent grandson his birthday card late he said it wasn't his birthday.  I told him oh yes, we can celebrate the whole month.  I'm not a winter person either, and find it easy to slip into feeling down.  Now we can look for that birthday sunshine together.  Birthday Hugs, Libby
Posts.Title: Have we missed a birthday? Sdearing??

Posts.Content: Luci, thinking of you and hoping all went well yesterday too.  Hugs, Libby
Posts.Title: Leaving for my mini-surgery as soon as I finish this....

Posts.Content: Glad your chemo went well and you sound so good.  I always found the anticipation of the unkown to be the worst.  Remember to rest and take care of you.  Hugs, Libby
Posts.Title: chemo went great

Posts.Content: I'd like to ask for some prayers.  My cousin's son is in the Army 1-1/2 years.  He was just sent over to Iraq.  His mom is devasted.  We're asking for prayers for his safety from everyone we know.
Posts.Title: Cousin's Son in Iraq... Prayer Request

Posts.Content: My heart is aching although I know our Connie is now at peace.  I never got to "meet" Connie but I felt like I had.  I shall miss her great wisdom; I had once told her I pictured her sitting in a huge room surrounded by books...she laughed.  Prayers going out to her beloved Bob and her family and friends... and to all of us.  We love you Connie.  Hugs, Libby
Posts.Title: About Connie

Posts.Content: Shells, sorry to hear you'll be going through surgery again.  I'll catch the PCE and be with you on Monday but I don't think the world is ready for me in pink long johns so I'll be bundled up and wear a pink scarf.  Gentle Hugs, Libby
Posts.Title: Having surgery, again!

Posts.Content: Prayers and hugs for Denise and her family.  A special hug for you too, Rita.  Thanks for keeping us updated.  Hugs, Libby
Posts.Title: Prayers for Denise

Posts.Content: Keeping Shells in my thoughts and prayers.  Hope she is resting and gaining strength.  Thanks Joyce for the updates.  Hugs to you both, Libby
Posts.Title: Giving Shelley a little more time to rest.

Posts.Content: Happy Birthday Stef.  Sounds like you are having a great time.  Nice touch ... DH putting present up and surprising you.  Enjoy the day celebrating you.  Hugs, Libby
Posts.Title: Happy Birthday Stepahnie, Wackygal

Posts.Content: Very powerful Jackie.  I always had a greater fear of the unknown than once you "give it a name".  Once the unknown no longer holds you in its fear I find it easier to pick myself up, dust myself off and start all over again.
Posts.Title: An interesting perspective on survival from a kids book

Posts.Content: Thanks Joyce for the update on Connie.  My love and prayers go out to her.  Hugs, Libby
Posts.Title: Connie is in the hospital!

Posts.Content: Okay gals, slide over.  I have my pink scarf on and am ready for the flight.  Prayers for all having their procedures and getting results.  Hugs, Libby
Posts.Title: General boarding call for PCE, please have boas ready...

Posts.Content: Congratulations to you Lori and the rest of the Freshman Class.  Nice to have some buddies.  I went through mine alone (8 years ago) and then hooked up with you guys (after 3 years).  I think the surgeon was surprised when I called the office 3 years later and asked for my pathology report... who knew?  Thanks guys.  Hugs, Libby
Posts.Title: "freshman class" of 2000 reunion......
Here we go again......

Posts.Content: Hey Kathy, I've been thinking about you. Great you are through one phase and back to work.  Continued prayers for you and DH.  Hugs, Libby
Posts.Title: long lost babyseeester

Posts.Content: Thanks Gail.  I was thinking about Janice this weekend, in fact I have a card in the mail to go out tomorrow.  I think a card shower will make her smile.  Hugs, Libby
Posts.Title: I just spoke to Janice in Wa.....

Posts.Content: Welcome home Miss Luci.  You sound like you are still "the teacher" in charge.  Good that they did listen to you... how exasperating.  And I love your NV cardiologist... nice when they can coordinate.  So glad you are home, but don't forget to rest (even if it is boring).
Posts.Title: Hellooo, I'm home....

Posts.Content: Hey Shells, glad you got home for Christmas.  Bet it was busy with that little one running all around.  Don't they just enjoy everything?  Got an Eyore t-shirt from my grandson (4 yrs old) and he told my DD she could wear it too if grandmom said it was okay.  I have to write these down before I forget.

Posts.Title: Testing, testing!

Posts.Content: Dear Luci, I'm so sorry you are having to go through all of this.  I am impressed with the thoroughness of your doctors and I'll be with you Monday for the tests and Tuesday with cardiologist.  You'll be in my thoughts and prayers too.  Love and Hugs, Libby
Posts.Title: I need help, my friends...

Posts.Content: Happy Birthday my dear Beck.  Well now, why did I have it in my mind that your birthday is tomorrow?  I'm glad others are on the ball.  Have a grand day sis.  Eat sherbert!

Posts.Content: B9 ... what a wonderful word.  Joining in on the happy dancing in New Jersey.  Hugs, Libby

Posts.Content: Happy Birthday Becky.  Enjoy your birthday doing what makes you smile.  (Of course that means eating cake and ice cream, right?)  Birthday Hugs, Libby
Posts.Title: Happy Birthday to "MightyBecky"...............

Posts.Content: Happy Birthday Kitty.  This is just what January needs, more birthday parties.  Enjoy your celebrating and pass me the ice cream (yes, even in winter).  Birthday Hugs, Libby

Posts.Content: Deb is home from the arthroscopic knee surgery.  She's resting on the couch with her leg elevated.  DH is waiting on her and DD brought supper over.  She is going back to doctor next Tuesday and should take it easy for a couple of weeks.  She sounded great.  She sends her love and thanks for the prayers.  Hugs, Libby
Posts.Title: I just spoke with Debbie (cupycake)....

Posts.Content: Congrats Miss Lori on reaching the 5 year milestone.  I felt better after reaching that one.

Posts.Content: OMG Cathi, Debbie T (cupycake) just read that to me so when I read this I thought, that sounds familiar.  Then I realized it was from the "calendar".  How great!  And ... when I saw the author's name, I think that is the minister that married my sister 43 years ago.  I'll have to check that out.  Thanks.  Love and Hugs, Libby

Posts.Content: Happy Birthday, Julie.  You had the best present ever.  What a doll that Hannah is.  Birthday Hugs, Libby

Posts.Title: Shelley needs the PCE

Posts.Content: (((Hi Teresa)))   I'm so glad your PET scan and blood work came back normal.  Isn't that a wonderful word - normal.   I think the hardest part is the waiting.  Every Sunday I light a candle in church for the Healing Well bc support board members.  Hope you can feel the hugs, Libby
Posts.Title: GREAT NEWS!!!!

Posts.Content: Hooray, Gail.  Happy dancing here for normal.  Happy Hugs, Libby
Posts.Title: Onc appt went well...

Posts.Content: Wow Lori, what a trip.  Wasn't driving in New Jersey fun?  We don't have the highest car insurance in the nation for nothing.  Oh my, Mt. Olive, East Hanover, places I know.  Mt. Olive driving better than East Hanover.  East Hanover they tend to put everything they can in about a 5 mile stretch.  I grew up with jug handles so am used to them but when my nephew (originally from NJ) came out to NJ a couple years ago whenever he drove anywhere on our highways his wife (originally from Idaho) kept her eyes shut.
Posts.Title: Finally home!

Posts.Content: Oh Annette, I'm so sorry.  What a lousy week.  I will keep your mom-in-law and sister's sister-in-law in my prayers.  Holding you tight, Libby

Posts.Content: Hey Shells, Happy Birthday, hon.  Hope you enjoy yourself today.  Hmmm brownies and ice cream, I'll be there.  Big Teddy Bear Hugs, Libby
